intro: Henckelia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats at high altitudes. Henckelia parviflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
